column4: ok i could set different permission on a file but i need to make it executable through the web instead of making it downloadable, as it's a perl script.. how can I go about that?
where is the script placed now?
in my server directory
where other html files are
off course. but perl scripts (by default) are only executable when placed in the 'cgi' directory
ahhhh.. never knew that.. ok i'll try that. thanks man.. lemme see if i can make it work with that tip
the cgi-bin directory is possibly /usr/lib/cgi-bin/ # you can use this command to make sure    grep -inHR cgi-bin /etc/apache2/
ah so putting it inside var/www/html/cgi-bin won't work.. because it didn't work in fact
well, you can change the location of your cgi-bin to  /var/www/html/cgi-bin/  if you like - but it's probably simpler to use the default directory and place your script in there
yeah indeed it is but then what would the url become?? /cgi-bin/script.pl ?
yea.  http://yourhost/cgi-bin/script.pl
now unfortunately people have to type http://myhost/html/index.html and i wanted to get rid of that /html/ step in there.. where can one change all these directory settings?
it seems you have placed all your content in /var/www/html/  - why not just have it all in /var/www/ ??

i stepped up on an already existing admin position.. anyway people don't really have to type all that, they just type the host and then it's redirected to myhost/html/ somehow.. and i don't have a clue as to how i could change that, as i'm not really acquainted with linux
well, it's in the config file for this particular site .. look in /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/
besides, the script now reacts this way: The server encountered an internal error or misconfiguration and was unable to complete your request.
so i'll eventually have to tinker with the configuration files
what does this script do?
nothin, just #!/bin/perl print("hi");
well, as far as CGI is concerned this perl script is incomplete - it does not print out any headers to notify the browser of the content type
the best thing to do is have another terminal open and run this to debug your script.    sudo tail -f /var/log/apache2/error.log
my guess is that you need another line.    print "Content-type: text/html\n\n"; # before print "hi";
i think perl isn't installed..
